page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO RISELEY
page.content: Riseley, a pleasant roadside village, is situated on a minor road eleven miles north of Bedford and three miles north-east of the A6 trunk road which runs through the south-west corner of our area, which is mostly farmland. Another road runs through Riseley and Knotting. The lastest estimate of population in Riseley is l0l2. Knotting, a much smaller village, consists of 26 households. There are seven farms; Knotting Green, Lodge, Manor, Strawberry Hill, High Barn and Haring's, the fields being separated by hedges and fences. Only five woods remain;Galsey Wood, Temple Wood, Temple Spinney, Penn Wood and Worley's Wood. Most of the soil is clay, so it is not surprising that there used to be a brickworks which supplied bricks for Riseley.
